ch.bfh.ti.gravis.core.graph

Class GravisGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.GraphDecorator<IVertex,IEdge>
      • ch.bfh.ti.gravis.core.graph.GravisGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEditGraphEventListener, IGravisGraph, edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.Graph<IVertex,IEdge>, edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.Hypergraph<IVertex,IEdge>, Serializable

     class GravisGraph
extends edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.GraphDecorator<IVertex,IEdge>
implements IGravisGraph, IEditGraphEventListener
    This implementation of the IGravisGraph interface decorates a graph of type Graph.
    Author:
    Patrick Kofmel (kofmp1@bfh.ch)

      • forceStartVertex

        public void forceStartVertex()
        Description copied from interface: IGravisGraph
        Forces the existence of a start vertex. If no start vertex is set, this method chooses and sets an arbitrary start vertex. If this graph is empty, no changes are performed.
        Specified by:
        forceStartVertex in interface IGravisGraph

      • validateGraphItems

        private void validateGraphItems()
        Validates all vertices and edges in this graph and corrects the invalid item properties. A valid graph has at most one start vertex and one end vertex. All item names must be unique.
